title: Bold, elegant serif
content:
Hello Typophiles,

Many thanks for your consideration—if you could ID this font I would appreciate it very much. Gorgeous, isn't it?

Greetings from Northern Ireland!

Paul

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Screen Shot 2014-02-19 at 17.15.37.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20140824065734/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20Shot%202014-02-19%20at%2017.15.37.png) | 278.97 KB |
author: paul_w

comments.content: Some digitalizations and interpretations of Pistilli Roman: [Pistilline](http://web.archive.org/web/20140824065734/http:/inkfonts.bigcartel.com/product/1960s-caps), [Eloquent](http://web.archive.org/web/20140824065734/http:/marketplace.veer.com/type/JBT0000118), [Spiffily](http://web.archive.org/web/20140824065734/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/spiffily-nf), [Maisalle](http://web.archive.org/web/20140824065734/http:/neutura.org/Maisalle.html), [Pistilli Roman](http://web.archive.org/web/20140824065734/http:/www.dafont.com/pistilli-roman.font), [Sahara Bodoni](http://web.archive.org/web/20140824065734/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bagraphics/sahara-bodoni)

Nice list, Ryuk.

What's with much of the description of Pistilline matching exactly the wording of Eloquent's description?
